ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. The texts were well-chosen and exposed the students to a wide array of subject matter.

The course covered a good variety of genres of texts that are written in both Sumerian and Akkadian. We discussed issues such as which text was the original, how to deal with differences between the two languages, a variety of sign forms, and other issues. I would recommend the course if you read both languages and are interested in more exposure to these topics.

I believe this course was an excellent source for anyone interested in a Sumerian-Akkadian bilingual discourse. During this class, we read several bilingual texts which provided excellent opportunities for students to compare and contrast the two languages side by side. I stongly recommend NELC students this bilingual course work.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course further developed my knowledge of Akkadian and Sumerian grammar.
Unclear what the topic of my dissertation will be as of yet, but it will certainly be helpful to have read more texts in both languages.
